item.title: Microsoft fixes Windows 11 24H2 updates failing with 0x80240069 error
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft has resolved a known issue preventing the August 2025 Windows 11 24H2 cumulative update from being delivered via Windows Server Update Services (WSUS). [...]

item.title: Google Gemini's Deep Research is finally coming to API
item.dc:creator: Mayank Parmar
item.description: Google Gemini's one of the most powerful features is Deep Research, but up until now, it has been strictly limited to the Gemini interface. This could change soon. [...]

item.title: OpenAI relaxes GPT-5 rate limit, promises to improve the personality
item.dc:creator: Mayank Parmar
item.description: OpenAI is slowly addressing all concerns around GPT-5, including rate limits and now its personality, which has been criticized for being less affirmative. [...]

item.title: Fortinet warns of FortiSIEM pre-auth RCE flaw with exploit in the wild
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Fortinet is warning about a remote unauthenticated command injection flaw in FortiSIEM that has in-the-wild exploit code, making it critical for admins to apply the latest security updates. [...]

item.title: Windows 11 24H2 updates failing again with 0x80240069 errors
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: The KB5063878 Windows 11 24H2 cumulative update, released earlier this week, fails to install on some systems according to widespread reports from Windows administrators. [...]

item.title: New downgrade attack can bypass FIDO auth in Microsoft Entra ID
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Security researchers have created a new FIDO downgrade attack against Microsoft Entra ID that tricks users into authenticating with weaker login methods, making them susceptible to phishing and session hijacking. [...]

item.title: Spike in Fortinet VPN brute-force attacks raises zero-day concerns
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A massive spike in brute-force attacks targeted Fortinet SSL VPNs earlier this month, followed by a switch to FortiManager, marked a deliberate shift in targeting that has historically preceded new vulnerability disclosures. [...]

item.title: Pennsylvania attorney general's email, site down after cyberattack
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: The Office of the Pennsylvania Attorney General has announced that a recent cyberattack has taken down its systems, including landline phone lines and email accounts. [...]

item.title: Microsoft removes PowerShell 2.0 from Windows 11, Windows Server
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft will remove PowerShell 2.0 from Windows starting in August, eight years after announcing its deprecation and keeping it around as an optional feature. [...]

item.title: Microsoft asks users to ignore certificate enrollment errors
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft has asked customers this week to disregard incorrect CertificateServicesClient (CertEnroll) errors that appear after installing the July 2025 preview update and subsequent Windows 11 24H2 updates. [...]

item.title: OpenAI adds new GPT-5 models, restores o3, o4-mini and it's a mess all over again
item.dc:creator: Mayank Parmar
item.description: One of the few things many disliked about ChatGPT was the confusing number of models. OpenAI claimed GPT-5 would fix this, but it seems to have made it worse. [...]

item.title: Claude gets 1M tokens support via API to take on Gemini 2.5 Pro
item.dc:creator: Mayank Parmar
item.description: Claude Sonnet 4 has been upgraded, and it can now remember up to 1 million tokens of context, but only when it's used via API. This could change in the future. [...]

item.title: Hackers leak Allianz Life data stolen in Salesforce attacks
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Hackers have released stolen data belonging to US insurance giant Allianz Life, exposing 2.8 million records with sensitive information on business partners and customers in ongoing Salesforce data theft attacks. [...]
